{{EngvarB|date=July 2013}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Tommie Hoban |image = TommieHoban.png |image_size = 175 |caption = Hoban playing for [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] in 2012 |fullname = Thomas Michael Hoban{{cite web|url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/staticFiles/4e/bd/0,,10794~179534,00.pdf|title=Professional retain list & free transfers 2012/13|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140802074454/http://www.football-league.co.uk/staticFiles/4e/bd/0,,10794~179534,00.pdf|date=18 May 2013|archivedate=2 August 2014|accessdate=4 January 2015|page=25|format=PDF|publisher=The Football League}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1994|1|24|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Tommie Hoban |url=http://www.11v11.com/players/tommie-hoban-237507/|publisher=11v11 |accessdate=12 January 2016}} |birth_place = [[Walthamstow]], England |height = {{height|m=1.88}} |position = [[Defender (association football)|Defender]] |currentclub = [[Aberdeen F.C.|Aberdeen]]
(on loan from [[Watford F.C.|Watford]]) |clubnumber = 28 |youthyears1 = 2002–2009 |youthclubs1 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] |youthyears2 = 2009–2011 |youthclubs2 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] |years1 = 2011– |clubs1 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] |caps1 = 54 |goals1 = 2 |years2 = 2012 |clubs2 = → [[Wealdstone F.C.|Wealdstone]] (loan) |caps2 = 7 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2016–2017 |clubs3 = → [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] (loan) |caps3 = 16 |goals3 = 1 |years4 = 2018– |clubs4 = → [[Aberdeen F.C.|Aberdeen]] (loan) |caps4 = 5 |goals4 = 1 |nationalyears1 = 2010–2011 |nationalteam1 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-17 football team|Republic of Ireland U17]] |nationalcaps1 = 6 |nationalgoals1 = 0 |nationalyears2 = 2012 |nationalteam2 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team|Republic of Ireland U19]] |nationalcaps2 = 1 |nationalgoals2 = 1 |nationalyears3 = 2014–2016 |nationalteam3 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-21 football team|Republic of Ireland U21]] |nationalcaps3 = 11 |nationalgoals3 = 1 |club-update = 10:14, 18 February 2019 (UTC) |ntupdate = }} '''Thomas Michael Hoban''' (born 24 January 1994) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Aberdeen F.C.|Aberdeen]], on loan from [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]]. Born in England, Hoban has represented the Republic of Ireland at youth international level. ==Club career== Born in [[Walthamstow]], London,{{cite book|editor1-first=Glenda|editor1-last=Rollin|editor2-first=Jack|editor2-last=Rollin|title=Sky Sports Football Yearbook 2012–2013|year=2012|publisher=[[Headline Publishing Group|Headline]]|location=London|isbn=978-0-7553-6356-8|page=547|edition=43rd}} Hoban grew up in the [[Chingford]] and [[Woodford Green]] area. He joined [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal's]] youth system at the age of 7 and was released at 14. Following his release eight clubs expressed an interest in Hoban, and from them he and his family selected [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] based on location and the recommendation of an Arsenal coach.{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/watfordfc/watfordfcnews/10170051._/?|title=Watford defender Tommie Hoban believes his release by Arsenal was a blessing in disguise|date=20 January 2013|author=Frank Smith|publisher=''Watford Observer''}} Hoban made his senior debut for Watford on 7 May 2011, in their final game of the [[2010–11 Watford F.C. season|2010–11 season]] against [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] coming on for [[Martin Taylor (footballer born 1979)|Martin Taylor]] in the first half. He turned professional three days later.{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/9017617.Hoban_latest_scholar_handed_deal/|title=Watford first-year scholar Tommie Hoban latest academy product to sign pro deal|date=10 May 2011|author=Frank Smith|publisher=''Watford Observer''}} Hoban moved on loan to [[Wealdstone F.C.|Wealdstone]] on 2 February 2012 until the end of the season,{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/9509960.Hoban_joins_Stones/|title=Watford defender Tommie Hoban makes loan move to Ryman Premier Division Wealdstone|date=2 February 2012|publisher=''Watford Observer''}} making 7 league appearances during his time at the club.{{cite web|url=http://wealdstone-fc.com/history/first-team-2011-12/|title=First Team 2011–12|date=28 August 2011|publisher=Wealdstone F.C.}} Following "rave reviews" in the Championship during the [[2012–13 Watford F.C. season|2012–13 season]], Hoban received attention from a number of Premiership clubs.{{cite web|url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/tommie-hoban-rocking-but-he-wont-let-big-guns-knock-him-off-course-8438170.html|title=Tommie Hoban rocking but he won't let big guns knock him off course|date=4 January 2013|author=Giuseppe Muro|publisher=London Evening Standard}} In February 2013, Hoban picked up an ankle injury.{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/watfordfc/watfordfcnews/10229968.Hoban_a_doubt_for_Birmingham_clash/|title=Watford defender Tommie Hoban a doubt for Birmingham City clash after suffering a recurrence of an ankle problem|date=14 February 2013|publisher=Watford Observer}} He signed on loan for [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] in August 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37195595|title=Blackburn Rovers sign Watford's Tommie Hoban and Bristol City's Derrick Williams|date=26 August 2016|publisher=|via=www.bbc.co.uk}} He scored his first goal for Blackburn in a 1–0 win over [[Nottingham Forest]] on 14 April 2017. Hoban suffered an anterior cruciate ligament injury at the start of the 2017–18 season.{{cite web|url=https://www.hertfordshiremercury.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/watford-defender-says-light-end-1116356|title=Hoban: Light at the end of the tunnel|first=Matt|last=Storey|date=25 January 2018|publisher=}} He moved on loan to [[Aberdeen F.C.|Aberdeen]] in July 2018.{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/16376250.tommie-hoban-watford-defender-joins-aberdeen-on-loan/|title=Hoban makes loan switch|website=Watford Observer}}{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44952201 |title=Aberdeen: Goalkeeper Tomas Cerny and defender Tommie Hoban join Dons |date=15 July 2018 |accessdate=19 February 2019 |work= |publisher=BBC Sport}} His time with Aberdeen was also severely affected by injury, and in February 2019 he suffered the second anterior cruciate ligament injury of his career.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47297340 |title=Watford's Tommie Hoban has Aberdeen loan season ended by knee injury |work= |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 February 2019 |accessdate=19 February 2019}} ==International career== Hoban was born in England but qualifies to play for the Republic of Ireland through his Dublin-born mother. His paternal grandparents are also Irish.[http://www.irishexaminer.com/sport/soccer/hornet-hoban-so-proud-to-wear-the-green-210533.html/ "Hornet Hoban so proud to wear the green "]. ''Irish Examiner''. 11 October 2012. Retrieved 8 November 2012. Hoban has represented Ireland at under-17 level, captained the under-19s and played for the under-21s.[http://m.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/9740403.Hoban_plays_as_Irish_pegged_back/ "Hoban plays as Irish pegged back"]. ''Watford Observer''. 1 June 2012. !colspan="2"|Career total !75!!4!!3!!0!!3!!0!!2!!0!!83!!4 |} ==Playing style== Hoban can play anywhere in defence but prefers to play centrally. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Aberdeen F.C. squad}}
